Reviews.Title: “A great find in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Lidema90
Reviews.Content: This place is a delight - right near Saint Mark's square and with loads of restaurants, shops and vineries/enotecas around. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good - a variety of foods were available from sweets to savouries! It's a very big hike from the train station - difficult with suitcases but it's only twice you have to do the big lug!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussieileen
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in this hotel and highly recommend to any travellers to Venice. The hotel is well located between St Marcos Square and the Rialto Bridge. The rooms are comfortable and beautifully decorated in Venetian style. Buffet breakfast is included in the price and includes a wide range of fresh fruits, cereals, breads, hams, cheese etc and freshly made coffee. Price includes free wifi. The staff are incredible, friendly and really go out their way to make sure you enjoy your stay in Venice. Fantastic value for such an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in winter”
Reviews.Author: ogulsev
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Nice and clean rooms. Breakfast was also nice. Do not know why the toilet did not have any doors. Maybe it was because I was single. Othet than that. Place is a good one in central Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Karoly75
Reviews.Content: San Luca is very well located, near to San Marco and to Rialto, but still neither noisy nor too crowded, as it is on a narrow side street. The buffet breakfast is excellent, although sometimes the tables are not sufficient if many people arrive at the same time. Rooms are nice, bathroomes excellent and well furnished. the staff is extremely heplful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: RachSan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annexes, another set of their apartments closer to piazza San Marco and only a 5 minute walk from their main hotel/reception and breakfast room. The location was fantastic, on a canal and so close to St Marks Square. Would definately stay here again, staff were so nice, breakfast was fantastic and situated in a very nice part of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the San Marco experience (if that's what you want)”
Reviews.Author: psychcal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Luca for two nights in July. As others have mentioned, if you want to be close to the San Marco attractions as well as alot (and I mean ALOT) of stores, the hotel is in a great location. We stayed in a triple room in the main hotel rather than the annex. The room was not huge (about 225-250 square feet) but it was very clean and nicely furnished, with the basic amenities (22" flat screen TV, mini-bar/fridge). The bathroom was extremely clean - it did have a sliding door with opaque glass on it, so privacy was a bit of an issue. As others have mentioned, getting a reliable wifi signal was an issue - we took our laptops down the hall to the breakfast room in order to get a stronger signal. The breakfast room was small (about 100 square feet with about 4-6 small tables) and the breakfast offerings were the same as we experienced in Rome and Florence (continental breakfast with cappucinos, milk, cereal, juices, yogurt, pastries, Nutella). Overall, if you want to stay in the San Marco area, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place and the service was really good”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLennie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "annexe", which is another set of apartments called Casa Dolce a few mintes away from Hotel San Luca but right above a canal. Our room was good-sized, had a balcony and it was superb. Renovated with a chandalier to die for with Murano glass features, the apartment was not your usual hotel stay. But being so different, it made the stay just that more memorable. We had to walk the few minutes every morning for breakfast back to San Luca, but this was part of the journey. In fac, getting around the streets of Venice is in itself an adventure. The hotel itself is boutique but everyone seemed to be happy. The breakfast room was quite small, but the food was really good, the selections were ample and the service was good. Coffee was freshly made for you and not limited to a cup of airline quality brewed coffee. Francesca and her team were keen to assist with any enquiries and helped us with a water taxi from our cana address direct to the area adjacent to the seaport for our following cruise. We recommend apartment 1 in Casa Dolce to anyne wanting somethng a little different whe visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Warning-Do not stay in the Annex. Hotel is fine but in noisy San Marco location.”
Reviews.Author: Ozer
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine and more than satisfactory(but do not stay in the dark and dungy Annex). Service, room, breakfast more than satisfactory. On one hand the location is close to things-on the other hand this makes it noisy. The whole San Marco location was just teeming with tourists in May-enjoyed taking the Vaporetto and going to quieter areas. Venice is a bit overwhelming at first.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: trobaba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 4 minute walk from San Marco, and about a 6 minute walk from the Rialto, so if you want to be near the most popular sights the location is great. Remember though that there is virtually no neighborhood life here; it's all commerce and tourism. Anyway. My room was new, very comfortably furnished, clean and modern bathroom. Helpful staff, good breakfast with cold cuts and croissants. Wireless internet was free on the deal I cut. If you get a good price, as I did in January, you will definitely feel that you have lucked out. The hotel is partners of some sort with a nearby restaurant (Trattoria da Gioia I think it's called), and they will recommend that you eat there. Don't. Restaurants in general in the vicinity seem to be largely run by non-Italians and I am wary of what they serve. There is some geniune ambiance across the Rialto bridge, at the open-air veggie and fish market; there is also some nighttime action at some wine bars on that side. The Goldoni cafe, practically around the corner from the hotel, serves wonderful, heavenly coffee. The steep flight of stairs leading up to the hotel may be an inconvenience to some, but I had no problem with it. I had a good stay and consider this place to be an above-average value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: miam_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was tucked away and really quaint. We stayed in the annex. The room was large and right on a canal. We could walk to everything, the location could not be beat. I thought it was a good value. The man that ran it was wonderful and jovial!

Reviews.Title: “A free trip to Murano”
Reviews.Author: AussieSophia
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay! Breakfast was organised with a espresso/latte/cuppucinos served as requested. Lady at breakfast and at the front desk ever so helpful. Internet wifi access needed to be improved as it was a bit of touch and go! Free day trip to Murano to a glass making factory tour was a great bonus!! Clean and really quaint venetian decor! Luved the room!! Location was perfect within 2 mins of either the Rialto Bridge or San Marco Sq!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY PLACE TO RELAX AND SLEEP AFTER ALONG DAY”
Reviews.Author: Nuha123
Reviews.Content: A small and cosy hotel ,really clean , great ,simple , modern bath room and bright colored decorated rooms which stands out from the other 3 star gloomy hotels with red or dark wall paper. Also the location is great really close to san marco ,you can enjoy a cupatino in the mornig with a simple breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of improvement needed for staff - Very good location”
Reviews.Author: travellingtoday
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, it being only a short distance from St. Marks square. The hotel was new and appeared to be clean. However, i was fairly surprised and dissatisfied by the welcome I received from the attendant at the front desk. I was travelling to an international conference in northern Italy by myself and my plan was to stay one night in a hotel in the centre of Venice so that I would avail of my time as best I could while in the city. He appeared to laugh in my face when he knew I was travelling alone and then placed me in the room exactly by the reception. I asked to be moved away from here when shown the room as I stated I wanted somewhere quiet but excuses were made saying it was the quietest room in the hotel! I was after taking a very early morning flight to Venice from western europe and an over-night bus prior to my flight. I was unable to go asleep with all the talking and noise from the reception desk which was just outside my room. My laptop also failed to connect to the wireless at the hotel and when I informed the same attendant at the desk and asked him if I could bring it out, he came straight into my room without any courtesy shown or asking for any permission. I felt this was an invasion of my privacy during my stay and noticed him looking around while in my room. Also, in contrast to the information stated by the hotel, all attendents on the reception desk cannot speak english in a competent manner as the nighttime attendant had very little english. In fact, only that I asked the attendant at the desk the following morning, I would have been given incorrect directions when leaving Venice the following day. Furthermore, when I decided to go to see St. Mark's square at midnight, I was instructed in a most unfriendly fashion that the doors were being locked and that I had only 20 minutes to go up and see it and come back again! I would expect much better staff service from a hotel that charge the rates that this hotel charges!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MEMSouthWales
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with good bed, sofa and safe. Bathroom facilities were excellent. Only downside in room 103, next to reception, was that the sound carried easily. It was very noisy in the afternoon if you were trying to have a quiet hour away from the heat. Everything else was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but if you can avoid Room 107.......”
Reviews.Author: Bumblingbetty
Reviews.Content: ........ this hotel was great for us. The location was perfect almost exactly half way between Rialto Bridge and San Marco. The room was done to a high standard with mini bar, hair dryer, heater, tissues, shampoo's etc. Even a safe in the room too. The only bad point of our actual room and I can't speak for other rooms in the hotel but it was the en-suite. Again it was impeccable, beautifully done in marble and lovely tiles floor, big sink, all you could ask for but it was a wet room. I don't normally have anything against a wet room but the design of this one was all wrong. The shower was in the middle of the room and simply got everything wet! This wasn't helped by the floors not being sloped very well so it didn't soak away very quickly. Having said that if you just want a shower in the morning before you head out for a days sightseeing then its fine as it is cleaned to a very high standard and all dry and nice when you return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & overall ok but”
Reviews.Author: ZAP9
Reviews.Content: at first sight the room seemed clean, but it was obvious that the room had only been superficially cleaned. For instance, below the sheets I found some hairs. Also, after showering the bathroom flooded. Breakfast was ok for a 2/3 star hotel, quality of the food was good, but do not expect anything spectacular. On the positive side, the staff was very friendly and both the bathroom and the room were quite spacious (with wooden floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tia777
Reviews.Content: Few minutes walk from San Marco. Less than 1 minute to Rialto. Nice clean rooms w/beautiful wood floor & wood trim. Tiny shower even by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with great location”
Reviews.Author: StLouisLynn2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, but the rooms are nicely appointed with lovely furnishings, nice private bathrooms, and comfortable beds. It is relatively new, and the staff was efficient and friendly. They all spoke English and were able to answer any questions. This hotel is right between the Rialto Bridge area and San Marco Square, so we wer able to access all areas of the city within a short time on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: colorations
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews from fellow Trip Advisor members I took a chance on Hotel San Luca. We stayed in their newer annex, located very near by on a quiet side street. Except for the occasional gondola going by the room in the adjacent canal it was quiet. It's small but clean and simply but adequately furnished. We frequented a nice wine and cheese shop around the corner for snacks in the room and the breakfast at the hotel was very nice. Staff pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. You might need muscles to use it.”
Reviews.Author: CruiserTravel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel as long as interior is considered. The rooms are very classy with lots of goodies packed in ( ac, sat tv, hair drier, bath ammenntities,safe, etc ). Very clean. Very friendly staff. The problems are : the hotel does not have its own pier. the nearest watertaxi/waterbus station (Rialto) is about 10 minutes away. You will have to drag your bags all the way to the hotel ( there are no bridges with stairs to cross, but still ... ). When you reach the hotel there is another surprise awaiting you - no elevator. You will have to strength your muscles once again and lift the bags up the stairs. But if you dont mind all this - the hotel is reaccommended indeed

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Mirin7
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, great location, good price. Very good staff, but they donÂ´t speak English well...like me :-)

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Luca
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Dei Fabbri 4671 | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
